content:
gerrymandering - gerrymandering is determined by congress and the state legislatures and if the court weighed in, they would start to be involved in legislative work which is not allowed
line item veto - this is giving lots of legislative powers to the president
congress electing president - this would make another branch become involved with each other
ex parte merryman - court trial w/ lincoln where he suspended habeas corpus (to throw southerners in jail) but that was unconstitutional and a power for congress not the president
war powers act - decisions from presidential emergency powers are checked by congress after 60 days
supreme court advise - supreme court advising for a bill is not allowed because that would make them involved in legislative work
